name: Eurostars Grand Marina Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is not a 5 star hotel more like a 4 star. The staff are brilliant but the building though reasonably new is starting to fall appart through neglect.
reviews.title: If you want a good nights sleep do not stay here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in was fine as were all the staff encountered but the room was below 3 star as to maintenance. All facilities were there LCD tv, mini-bar, power shower, whirlpool bath the list goes on.
reviews.title: Great views but stuffy staff

likes.disliked: — Far too formal staff, unafordable bar, even for a nightcap.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But the maintenance of these was none existant.
reviews.title: Noisy Hotel

likes.liked: — free fruit on top floor bar
likes.disliked: — the bar is too near the resteraunt area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cheap laminate flooring was starting to lift leaving sharp edges to catch your feet on, the shower door failed to close as it was coming away from the wall so massive amounts of water covered the bathroom (remember it is a power shower).
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The Patio doors on the minute balcony refused to close or lock.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.liked: — The pilow choice was extra special, the accomodations in general, helpfulness of staff

reviews.title: Better than I thought
reviews.text: We were at the hotel for only two days Sep. 26th,27th. We were treated very well; the staff was friendly and helpful. The food at the restaurant was excellent and well presented. The views from our room and the roof were spectacular.

reviews.title: Top Class Hotel
reviews.text: Highly reccommended.

reviews.title: Wonderful 3-night stay - 10th - 13th October 2004
reviews.text: My Hubby and I stayed at the hotel 24-27th Sept for the first leg of our Honey Moon, and what a delight. We were upgraded to a Junior Suite with Champers & Chocolates.

reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel with great service
reviews.text: Our room was cleaned daily with a turn down service every evening. The location was excellent with a 5 min stroll to La Ramblas.

reviews.title: Great location especially for Cruise ships and great rooms
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel to anyone, it can be pricie, but well worth it. Definately worth it's

reviews.title: Great Hotel, Good Location
reviews.text: My family of three stayed at the Eurostars Grand Marina in Aug 2004. There are two reasons to pick this hotel. One, its a 5 minute walk to the La Ramblas and the start point for the city bus tours. Two, its a modern and well designed hotel overlooking the marina. Granted, it's a bit pricey, especially when you factor in that we drove and parking can cost you 30 Euro a night. But we would go back to this hotel on our next visit to Barcelona.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2004
reviews.text: I booked the Eurostars Grand Marina from 3rd - 6th December for my fiance's 30th Birthday weekend. This modern and beautifully decorated hotel is situated on the port. It is nice and quiet (cruise ship horns excepted) and 5 minutes walk from the bottom of the Ramblas.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Wonderful Views of the City
Highly recommended......
reviews.text: On arriving I was very slightly disappointed with the room, designated Superior in a 5 star hotel although it was large and pleasant enough.

reviews.title: wonderful hotel
reviews.text: I had specifically asked for a view and a wonderful view of the city it was (although in the promotional photos of the hotel and with the benefit of a wide angled lens, the huge cable car station right in front of the hotel is absent!). Try to stay 6th floor or above and either to the left or right of the front of the hotel. If you stay at the back you will look onto a pleasant courtyard and World Trade Centre.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2004
reviews.text: I emailed the concierce service before travelling to ask for a special touch for my fiance's birthday and we received, on arrival, a bottle of ice cold cava and chocolate covered strawberries.. yum.
reviews.title: Gorgeous- great ending to my whirlwind European trip
Fantastic Hotel, Brilliant staff, let down by NOISE
reviews.text: On Arriving it was a relief to arrive to some normality from staying in Paris for two nights, the staff were faultless from start to finish, the room, which i paid extra to upgrade on arrival, was fantastic, nice dark wood floor, great bathroom, travertine tiles, spa bath, the bedroom was brilliant, pillow menu, kingsize bed and 180degree views of the harbour, however the view was the let down, 5am a ferry docked up right outside my window, to be honest it would have been everyone on that side's window as it was so big, cue a very loud PA speaker for 15 mins, followed by men hitting metal on metal for i have no idea what reason, all in all a great stay completley ruined, if i had any heavy inate objects i would have thrown them at said chaps with hammers or whatever it was they were so carelessly using.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: i would have given this hotel a 4 or 5 rating but the noise really did ruin everything, it's totally without justification for a hotel of this price and class to sell someone a room knowing that at 5am there will be noise that literally no one could sleep through, earplugs and double-tripple glazing couldn't have drowned it out.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: that being said, do stay here, but make sure that if you do, as you look at the hotel from the front, only stay on the left hand side looking onto the city rather than the harbour, even then i think that PA will travel.
reviews.title: Fantastic staff, very freindly

likes.liked: — clean nicely decorated rooms, lovely showers and bathrooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed Grand Marine on Aug.24 for 1 night. As it was a special day for me, so I booked a liitle more higherend hotel as I usually book. As I work for travel industry, I know all good and bad. After my thorough research and arriving this hotel, I was very happy with my choice. Very professional employees, very spacious room(we stayed primier room), very modern but not cheap interior,excellent breakfast, etc. We got a room for city view with terrace whcih we could enjoy nice Balcelona city night view.
reviews.title: Excellant service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived before check in time and our room was not ready, but they took us to their cefeteria which was also nice(we sat terrace) and being offered drink while we wait. Great location. Convenient to walk to main street. The only negative part was jacuzzi in our room was not working. But even with this negative part, I score 5 stars with the price compare to much more price other 5 star hotels charge.
reviews.title: Good But Not Great

likes.disliked: — location not put in value by hotel's layout

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2004
reviews.text: I don't know what the previous poor reviews were about. As ever before deciding which hotel to book, we consulted Tripadvisor, and as ever the recommendations were spot on.
reviews.title: Excelent Hotel
Good - but not that good!
reviews.text: This is a wonderful hotel. Pricy certainly, but worth it. We stayed at the Eurostars Grand Marina for out 1st wedding anniversary. We were no sooner in the door when room service rang and introduced themselves and asked if it would be convenient to deliver some champagne and strawberries. Great start. The breakfast is perfect, the service and food are great. Guest Services were very helpful and pointed us in the right direction for everything. The staff were efficient, courteous and pleasant, even the morning after the "Catalonian festival" where the majority of the staff would have been out partying until 6 AM.

reviews.title: Not 5 star quality
reviews.text: The rooms were huge (Not the basic rooms though, we did catch a glimpse of one of these and it looked small), with great bathrooms, a walk in wardrobe, spa bath etc. They were also quiet. We had a room overlooking the front, and had no problem with the ships docked next to us. You would have to be the lightest sleeper on earth for that to bother you.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2004
reviews.text: One word of warning though, The Dinner menu is "Creative" to say the least. Although it was an experience, there are far better dinner menus to be had in town.
reviews.title: Great Overall Experience
Great Location - Expensive
reviews.text: We stayed here 2 nights on our honeymoon in August 2004.

reviews.title: Amazing hotel
reviews.text: Decided to splurge on this hotel as it was our honeymooon.

reviews.title: Missing Barcelona
reviews.text: Great location next to the water and you can see Barcelona pier and La Ramblas area.

reviews.title: Perfect for a pre or post cruise stay
reviews.text: PROS:

reviews.title: Fantastic, Modern and friendly!!
reviews.text: -Since it was our honeymoon, they gave us a bottle of champagne and chocolate strawberries complimentary.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Biggest problem: our iPod Nano was stolen from our rucksack, most likely by hotel staff. We checked out at 12pm, and left our bags in their storage, since our flight was not until 10pm. After sight seeing, we collected our bags and went straight to the airport, in a taxi, with the rucksack at our feet. After check in, (we had no check in luggage) we realised the iPod was missing. We've since contacted the hotel, but they say they cannot find it, and have no idea. I remember packing the iPod into the top pocket of the bag, and it had been in the hotel's care between the time we checked out of the hotel, to the time we were at the airport. There was no way it was stolen while at the airport as i was carrying the bag infront of me.
reviews.title: Stolen iPod Nano, but OK besides that

likes.liked: — Great gym equipment, good tapas at lobby lounge
likes.disliked: — ipod nano was stolen by staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Gym: great equipment and range of weights; better than most hotel gyms. However, the air con was not on high, so it got really hot. Plus, they played the same music everyday, and it was very slow and mellow, totally unsuitable for a workout.
reviews.title: Great view if you get it

likes.disliked: — Lack of wine glases, corkscrew, plates in room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pool: Small
reviews.title: Perfect when visiting Barcelona in summer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lobby Lounge: great tapas, especially the seafood. The best meal of our trip. Cost about 100 euros for about 7 tapas and wine, and coffee
reviews.title: Ultra Modern Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room: great little touch of a choice of pillows to choose from, all named after old hollywood actresses.
reviews.title: Honeymoon
Stunning room.
reviews.text: We used the celebration break offer which included the upgrade room, bottle of Cava and chocolate dipped strawberries. The window in the room overlooked the port and was 50ft long!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel is smart but was a bit characterless, probably due to the lack of customers so soon after christmas, however the staff were very friendly and helpful. We used the restaurant which was high quality but expensive - and empty.
reviews.title: Good hotel in an excellent tourist location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is good, but the long entrance to the front of the hotel makes a stroll to Las Rambles quite long. On the negative side, the pictures are misleading as most of the building is the World Trade Ctr and not the hotel, and the front view is spoiled by the big pylon/tower in front, but this did not spoil it for us.
reviews.title: I love this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: I would recommend the hotel and hope to return next time I visit Barcelona.
reviews.title: Better than suggested - but could do better, nonetheless

likes.liked: — The wonderful views up and down the harbour from the roof-top terrace.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: I chose this hotel for a two night stay in Barcelona for quality and location at a good price. At around £125 per night it offered great value.
reviews.title: My nightmare at the Eurostars
Deservedly worth it's five stars
reviews.text: Excellent. One of the best hotels in Barcelona. We stayed in one of the suites for a night before getting on a cruise and it was undoutebly one of the nicest rooms we've ever had. There were two living rooms, one by the balcony, with a rollaway bed for our daughter and a main one with a tv, Bang and Olufsen radio and the mini bar. Then there was the double bedroom, the bathroom, with a big jacuzzi bath and Hermes toiletries and a wet room shower. Then there was the wardrobe area and an additional toilet. The decor was very tasteful with maple wood and dark blue furnishings. The club lounge was very good with internet access, a gym and very good viewpoints onto the harbour.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2004
reviews.text: The breakfast was also good. We would definately recommend this hotel, especially the suites.
reviews.title: Paper Thin Walls
Lovely Hotel!
reviews.text: Just returned from 3 nights at this hotel over new years. The location of the hotel is great, cannot be faulted. However when you see the pictures of the hotel you think, well I did anyway, that the majority of the "circular building" was the hotel. In fact only the front part facing the city is the hotel the rest are office buildings !

reviews.title: Loved the Complimentary decor
reviews.text: The service in the hotel is second to none, they really treat you well. I went for a Premier Room at 250 Euro per night. It was a great room with a great view of the city and the bottom corner of the port. If you go for a standard room as some of the people I got talking to did, the view was into a person office. The whole back of the hotel looks into offices. There is a cable car station outside the hotel that is about 15 stories high that blocks the view of the city if you are unlucky to get a front room in the middle.

reviews.title: Loved the bath!!
reviews.text: The floors in the room are wooden and look nice BUT with a wooden floor comes the noise. You can hear people walking on the floors in the adjoining rooms and upstairs which can be damn annoying. Also the walls are very thin so you can hear people talking and doing "other" things very clearly which can be infuriating when you're trying to have a lie in. That was disapointing for us.

reviews.title: Perfect short break
reviews.text: Went with a girlfriend over Easter weekend - left the kids with husband. We got a 'premier' room on the basis of my recent birthday!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2005
reviews.text: Great views of the city, and the best bathroom you can imagine - twin sinks, jacuzzi bath, huge shower space with jets, all in marble... Room safe, dressing area, really comfy beds and lots of freebies. Would find the beds made up and towels replaced every single time we returned, whatever time of day and however many times. Lots of walking since the bottom end of La Rambla was at least half a mile away, but tour buses stop right outside. The ferries outside make a bit of noise and we thought everything was a bit overpriced but hey - we came back refreshed and ready for real life!
reviews.title: Excellent
Fantastic service
reviews.text: The other reviews sum up this hotel very well. My wife and I have been to many top hotels around the world and this is quite simply the best one we have stayed in. And as for been expensive - this really is a case of you get what you pay for, and more!

reviews.title: Nice, new hotel.
reviews.text: Large hotel which caters more for business and corporates. however the serve provided is better than anything my wife or I have experienced- nothing short of out of this world.The room was upgraded to a superior room overlooking the harbour and marina with an large window of 50 feet in length. it was our anniversary and a bottle of champagne was sent up with chocolates compliments of the management. it was expensive however we did not regret for one moment our choice of hotel. Highly recommended as an exclusive hotel break to pamper yourselves.

description: A Mediterranean surrounding, Avant-garde Art and a soft sea Breeze envelope the privileged facilities at the Eurostars Grand Marina Hotel ***** GL. It is located in the World Trade Centre – leisure and business Complex in the middle of Barcelona's Old Harbour. The colourful Ramblas street and the magic of the Gothic Quarter make the perfect match for a unique feeling which is to be experienced from any of the eight floors of our magnificent Hotel. Both businessmen & women and leisure tourists will find in the Eurostars Grand Marina Hotel a wonderful place to enjoy a perfect stay, surrounded by every possible amenity and comfort. An excellent communications network that connects the Hotel to the Old Town and to the Financial District simply adds that little extra to a truly luxurious offer.
